title: Augusta County: William L. Coan to Samuel Hunt, December 8, 1865
summary: Coan discusses an imminent excursion to Lexington where he plans to establish an AMA school. He requests that the Association send additional teachers to Lexington, adding, "Lexington is a hard place for 'Nigger teachers.'" In the postscript, Coan remarks, "The work seems to be opening up larger in the Valley than I at first supposed it would."
keywords: African Americans, Education, Women, American Civil War
